baseShields.name: Buckler
baseShields.text: This very small shield is a favorite of duelists and quick, lightly armored warriors. It’s typically made of steel and strapped to your forearm. You can Raise a Shield with your buckler as long as you have that hand free or are holding a light object that’s not a weapon in that hand.

baseShields.name: Wooden Shield
baseShields.text: Though they come in a variety of shapes and sizes, the protection offered by wooden shields comes from the stoutness of their materials. While wooden shields are less expensive than steel shields, they break more easily.

baseShields.name: Steel Shield
baseShields.text: Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

baseShields.name: Tower Shield
baseShields.text: These massive shields can be used to provide cover to nearly the entire body. Due to their size, they are typically made of wood reinforced with metal.  Getting the higher bonus for a tower shield requires using the   action while the shield is raised.

specialShields.name: Cold Iron Buckler (Low-Grade)
specialShields.craftrequirements: cold iron worth at least 15 sp
specialShields.text: Cold iron shields don’t typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons. The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, and BT 6.

specialShields.name: Cold Iron Shield (Low-Grade)
specialShields.craftrequirements: cold iron worth at least 17 sp
specialShields.text: Cold iron shields don’t typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons. The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

specialShields.text: Cold iron shields don’t typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons. The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

specialShields.name: Silver Buckler (Low-Grade)
specialShields.text: Silver shields don’t typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons. The shield has Hardness 1, HP 4, and BT 2.

specialShields.text: Silver shields don’t typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons. The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, and BT 6.

specialShields.name: Adamantine Buckler (Standard-Grade)
specialShields.text: Adamantine shields are particularly sturdy, and when used for a shield bash, they are adamantine weapons. The shield has Hardness 8, HP 32, and BT 16.

specialShields.text: Adamantine shields are particularly sturdy, and when used for a shield bash, they are adamantine weapons. The shield has Hardness 10, HP 40, and BT 20.

specialShields.text: Adamantine shields are particularly sturdy, and when used for a shield bash, they are adamantine weapons. The shield has Hardness 11, HP 44, and BT 22.

specialShields.text: Adamantine shields are particularly sturdy, and when used for a shield bash, they are adamantine weapons. The shield has Hardness 13, HP 52, and BT 26.

specialShields.name: Darkwood Buckler (Standard-Grade)
specialShields.text: Darkwood shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, and BT 6.

specialShields.text: Darkwood shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

specialShields.text: Darkwood shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

specialShields.text: Darkwood shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). The shield has Hardness 8, HP 32, and BT 16.

specialShields.name: Darkwood Tower Shield (High-Grade)
specialShields.text: Darkwood shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). The shield has Hardness 8, HP 32, and BT 16.

specialShields.name: Dragonhide Buckler (Standard-Grade)
specialShields.text: Dragonhide shields are each immune to one damage type based on the type of dragon  . The shield has Hardness 2, HP 8, and BT 4.

specialShields.name: Dragonhide Shield (Standard-Grade)
specialShields.text: Dragonhide shields are each immune to one damage type based on the type of dragon  . The shield has Hardness 4, HP 16, and BT 8.

specialShields.name: Dragonhide Buckler (High-Grade)
specialShields.text: Dragonhide shields are each immune to one damage type based on the type of dragon  . The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

specialShields.name: Dragonhide Shield (High-Grade)
specialShields.text: Dragonhide shields are each immune to one damage type based on the type of dragon  . The shield has Hardness 7, HP 28, and BT 14.

specialShields.name: Mithral Buckler (Standard-Grade)
specialShields.text: Mithral shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). When used for a shield bash, they are treated as silver weapons. The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, and BT 6.

specialShields.name: Mithral Shield (Standard-Grade)
specialShields.text: Mithral shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). When used for a shield bash, they are treated as silver weapons. The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, BT 10.

specialShields.text: Mithral shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). When used for a shield bash, they are treated as silver weapons. The shield has Hardness 6, HP 24, and BT 12.

specialShields.name: Mithral Shield (High-Grade)
specialShields.text: Mithral shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). When used for a shield bash, they are treated as silver weapons. The shield has Hardness 8, HP 32, and BT 16.

specialShields.name: Orichalcum Buckler (High-Grade)
specialShields.text: Orichalcum shields’ time-bending properties are particularly useful for keeping them intact. The first time each day an orichalcum shield would be destroyed, it is instead left with 1 Hit Point and the broken condition. The shield has Hardness 14, HP 56, and BT 28.

specialShields.name: Orichalcum Shield (High-Grade)
specialShields.text: Orichalcum shields’ time-bending properties are particularly useful for keeping them intact. The first time each day an orichalcum shield would be destroyed, it is instead left with 1 Hit Point and the broken condition. The shield has Hardness 16, HP 64, and BT 32.

specialShields.name: Sturdy Shield (Minor)
specialShields.craftrequirements: The shield has Hardness 8, HP 64, and BT 32.
specialShields.text: With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

specialShields.name: Sturdy Shield (Lesser)
specialShields.craftrequirements: The shield has Hardness 10, HP 80, and BT 40.
specialShields.text: With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

specialShields.name: Sturdy Shield (Moderate)
specialShields.craftrequirements: The shield has Hardness 13, HP 104, and BT 52.
specialShields.text: With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

specialShields.name: Sturdy Shield (Greater)
specialShields.craftrequirements: The shield has Hardness 15, HP 120, and BT 60.
specialShields.text: With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

specialShields.name: Sturdy Shield (Major)
specialShields.craftrequirements: The shield has Hardness 17, HP 136, and BT 68.
specialShields.text: With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

specialShields.name: Sturdy Shield (Supreme)
specialShields.craftrequirements: The shield has Hardness 20, HP 160, and BT 80.
specialShields.text: With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

specialShields.name: Lion's Shield
specialShields.text: This steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 36, BT 18) is forged into the shape of a roaring lion’s head. The lion’s head functions as   that can’t be removed from the shield.
specialShields.effect: You animate the lion’s head. You Raise the Shield and make a melee Strike with it as part of the same action. The shield’s biting maw is a martial melee weapon that deals 2d6 piercing damage and has the deadly 1d6 trait; it can’t be enhanced by runes. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, during which time you can Strike with it each time you Raise the Shield, as well as with a Strike action.

specialShields.name: Spellguard Shield
specialShields.text: This shield bears eldritch glyphs to guard against magic. While you have this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) raised, you gain its circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells that target you (as well as to AC).

specialShields.name: Spined Shield
specialShields.text: Five jagged spines project from the surface of this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12). The spines are  . When you use the  Shield Block  reaction with this shield, the spines take the damage before the shield itself does. When the shield would take damage (after applying Hardness), one spine snaps off per 6 damage, reducing the damage by 6. The shield takes any remaining damage. When there are no spines left, the shield takes damage as normal. When all the spines are gone, you lose the ability to attack with them until the spines regenerate the next day.
specialShields.effect: You shoot one of the shield’s spines at a target. A fired spine uses the spikes’ statistics, but it is a martial ranged weapon with a range increment of 120 feet.

specialShields.name: Force Shield
specialShields.text: The edges of this elaborately engraved steel shield (Hardness 8, HP 32, BT 16) bear tiny glass tiles set in mosaic patterns.
specialShields.effect: The shield surrounds you with a bubble of force that protects you from harm, granting you resistance 5 to physical damage for 1 minute. The bubble disappears if you cease holding the shield.

specialShields.name: Dragonslayer's Shield
specialShields.text: A   is a steel shield covered with dragonhide from a certain type of dragon, which distinguishes each shield from the others. While raised, this steel shield (Hardness 8, HP 32, BT 16) grants its circumstance bonus to Reflex saves against area effects (as well as to AC, as normal).  While you hold the shield, it also grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Will saves against a dragon’s frightful presence ability. The shield has resistance 10 against the damage type corresponding to the type of dragon whose hide was used in its creation; this applies after reducing the damage for Hardness, so when you use Shield Block, the   takes 18 less damage from attacks of that damage type. You can use Shield Block against attacks that deal damage of that type.

specialShields.name: Forge Warden
specialShields.text: The religious symbol of  Torag , the forge god—an ornate hammer of dwarven construction—adorns the face of this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12). The shield is a religious symbol of Torag.  You and any adjacent allies have fire resistance 5 while you have the shield raised. When used for a Shield Block, the   rings out like the hammer strike of a blacksmith, and the symbol glows as if lit by the fires of a furnace.
specialShields.trigger: You use the forge warden to Shield Block an adjacent creature’s attack and the shield takes damage;
specialShields.effect: The attacking creature takes 2d6 fire damage.

The shield magically releases itself and floats off your arm into the air next to you, granting you its bonus automatically, as if you had Raised the Shield. Because you’re not wielding the shield, you can’t use reactions such as Shield Block with the shield, but you gain its benefits even when using both of your hands. After 1 minute, the shield drops to the ground, ending its floating effect. While the shield is adjacent to you, you can Interact to grasp it, ending its floating effect early.
specialShields.name: Floating Shield
specialShields.text: A   is usually carved with wing motifs. This buckler (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) can protect you on its own.

specialShields.name: Floating Shield (Greater)
specialShields.craftrequirements: You can activate the shield any number of times per day.
specialShields.text: A   is usually carved with wing motifs. This buckler (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) can protect you on its own.

specialShields.name: Arrow-Catching Shield
specialShields.text: This wooden shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) is carved with images of overlapping fletched arrows.
specialShields.trigger: A ranged weapon Strike targets a creature within 15 feet of you when you have this shield raised, and the attacker has not yet rolled their attack;
specialShields.effect: The triggering Strike targets you instead of its normal target. If it hits, you gain the effects of the

specialShields.name: Reforging Shield
specialShields.text: This steel shield contains a smoldering core of magma that never cools. Whenever the   current Hit Points are below its Break Threshold, the shield recovers 5 Hit Points at the start of its wielder’s turn each round until it is no longer broken. Each time a character Repairs the shield, the shield recovers double the number of Hit Points. The shield has Hardness 15, HP 120, and BT 60.
specialShields.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 76

specialShields.name: Nethysian Bulwark
specialShields.text: This round shield is often fashioned to resemble the religious symbol of its dual-natured namesake. A   is a  high-grade cold iron shield  (Hardness 10, HP 40, BT 20) that defends the wielder and can explode with retributive force when struck.
specialShields.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 77
specialShields.trigger: The shield becomes broken when performing a  Shield Block;
specialShields.effect: The shield explodes in a burst of bright light and shadowy tendrils, releasing a 15-foot cone of force that must include the attacker if possible. The cone deals 6d8 force damage to all creatures in the area (DC 34 basic Reflex save).

specialShields.name: Reflecting Shield
specialShields.text: This high-grade silver buckler (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) is polished to a mirrorlike sheen. The shield functions as a  spellguard shield  that can also reflect spells.
specialShields.trigger: You are targeted by a spell;
specialShields.effect: You attempt to reflect the spell on its caster, with the effects of a 9th-level  spell turning with a counteract modifier of +40.
specialShields.craftrequirements: Supply one casting of  spell turning, and the initial raw materials must include at least 2,750 gp of silver.

specialShields.name: Indestructible Shield
specialShields.text: An   is a high-grade adamantine shield (Hardness 13, HP 90) that can withstand just about any damage. It can be damaged only by a  disintegrate  spell (roll damage as if against a creature that failed its save) or by an artifact tied to destruction, such as a  .
specialShields.craftrequirements: The raw materials must include at least 4,400 gp of adamantine.
